page.title: 02 The Clay Lands Of Wellow.
page.content: Ref:04310119 From Ryedown Farm to Bellconey Copse you cross a rough clay soil pasture containing a bull and friesian cows, but in the next field the pasture is better.Near Bellconey Copse the land is marshy and badly drained with deciduous trees;oak,beech and horsechestnut. Crossing the stream and turning right there are wheat fields next to a Sewage Works by the River Blackwater.Behind Coopers Cottage and Farhill Farm is a ploughed clay field.Opposite the buildings is a copse of deciduous and evergreen trees.Turning towards Warners Farm there is a field of oil rape seed. Past Wellow Mill Bridge,there is a pumping station and by the stream is a clump of deciduous trees. By Katy Frost,Imogen Lee,Amanda Warwick
